title: WeissLaw LLP: ILG, Inc Acquisition May Not Be in the Best Interests of ILG Shareholders
text:
NEW YORK, May 1, 2018 /PRNewswire/ -- WeissLaw LLP is investigating possible breaches of fiduciary duty and other violations of law by the Board of Directors of ILG, Inc. ("ILG" or the "Company") (NASDAQ: ILG) in connection with the proposed acquisition of the Company with Marriott Vacations Worldwide Corp. ("Marriott") (NYSE: VAC) in a cash-and-stock transaction valued at approximately $4.7 billion. Under the terms of the agreement, the Company's shareholders will be entitled to receive $14.75 in cash and 0.165 of a Marriott share for each ILG share they own, representing consideration of $34.88 based on Marriott's April 30 opening price.
WeissLaw is investigating whether ILG's Board acted to maximize shareholder value prior to entering into the agreement. Notably, at least one analyst set a target price of $38.00 per ILG share, or $3.12 more than the per-share consideration.
Given these facts, WeissLaw is investigating whether ILG shareholders will obtain their fair and proportionate share of the Company's continued success and growth prospects.
